title.native: イノセント・ヴィーナス

description:
In the year 2010 AD, Hyper Hurricanes born concurrently all over the world caused severe damage. Five billion people lost their lives, decreasing the world's population to 3 billion. Existing economies and militaries were wiped out. Countries were frozen under solid ice, plains sank beneath seas, the world was changed dramatically.

Human civilization enters a chaotic era. Poverty flourished outside of these ecomomic zones and slums were widespread. The ruling class called themselves Logos and maintained their position by force of arms. They call the poor Revenus, who are exiled to live outside the special economic areas.

Time has passed since then. Katsuragi Jo and Tsurasawa Jin, escape from Phantom, a force organised to watch Revenus and to suppress renegade elements of the Logos, taking with them a mysterious girl, Noto Sana. There are many who are interested in her, all with their own reasons.

name.native: マキシマス・ドレイク

node.description:
[Official Website](http://www.topazios.net/) 

Yui Itsuki is a Japanese voice actress who works for Holy Peak. As a musician, she is currently the lead vocalist for the band Yousei Teikoku (under the persona of "Dictator for Life" 終身独裁官, the supreme leader of The Fairy Empire).

[Official Website](http://dasfeenreich.com/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6CDPvGtPJ6Iz7uftJYQpxO?autoplay=true) 

Yousei Teikoku is a four-member Japanese musical unit, formed in 1997 and part of TEAM FAIRITHM. Their music contains elements of electro, EBM, darkwave, neoclassical, ethereal and ambient mixed with gothic rock/metal. They have released several independent albums and four major release albums with their current publisher Lantis: Gothic Lolita Propaganda, metanoia, Gothic Lolita Doctrine and Gothic Lolita Agitator.  The members are: 

Itsuki Yui - vocals, chorus, and lyric writing. | Tachibana Takaha - keyboards, guitar, composition, arrangement and lyric writing. Has worked with Kukui in the past. | Nanami - bass guitar. | Relu - drums. 

Prior to the release of Baptize, Yui and Tachibana were the group's only members. Nanami and Relu have since been added. Yousei Teikoku literally means Fairy Empire. Through music, Yousei Teikoku is attempting to revive the Fairy Empire that exists between the human world and the spiritual realm known as Spiritual. The purpose of their music is "to make humans remember the pure heart inside them that believes in fairies, forgotten before we knew it". "Gothic" and "empire" are key words in their musical ideas.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/川越淳)

Started off as an animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/川越淳)

Started off as an animator.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

He started his career at Studio Live working on outsourced episodes for a few years. His first major role was as mechanical designer on the short series [The Cosmopolitan Prayers](https://anilist.co/anime/112/).

After leaving Studio Live he was involved in several [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) and [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) projects, with the former studio housing his debut as director on the short TOYOTA commercial series [PES: Peace Eco Smiles](https://anilist.co/anime/13427/).

He's been affiliated with Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) since 2014 where he helmed his first TV Series, [Garo: The Animation](https://anilist.co/anime/20753/), and several other anime.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Persona 5: Royal (Video Game, 2019) (OP Director, OP Storyboard, OP Key Animation)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/土師勝弘)

Freelancer, formerly part of Studio Uni.
Is the leader for the band [fhána](https://anilist.co/staff/118915/fhana) as well as keyboardist and vocalist.
Is the leader for the band [fhána](https://anilist.co/staff/118915/fhana) as well as keyboardist and vocalist.
